text: Elevator type (hydraulic, traction, MRL), capacity, speed, stops match drawings and spec
Shop drawings and layout approved by consultant and coordinated with structural and MEP trades
Cab finish schedule (walls, flooring, handrails, ceiling) matches architectural design intent
Power requirement, shaft ventilation, and lighting coordinated
Shaft dimensions verified against elevator supplier layout
Pit depth, sump pump, and waterproofing installed per manufacturer and local code
Hoist beam, brackets, and embedded steel placed per elevator supplier drawings
Machine room or overhead clearance provided per shop drawings
Rails, buffers, hoist cables (if applicable) installed and aligned
Car frame, counterweight, and guide shoes assembled per spec
Cab enclosure installed, finish materials protected until turnover
Doors, operators, and door tracks aligned and function-tested
Fire recall, intercom, emergency lighting, and battery backup installed
Safety tests completed: load test, overspeed, emergency brake
Inspection passed by provincial/state elevator authority (e.g., TSSA, ASME inspector)
Final cleaning, decals, Braille signage, and safety notices installed
Warranty, logbooks, and operation manual submitted

id: • ASME A17.1 / CSA B44, ADA / CSA B651, NBC, TSSA (Ontario)
• ISO 4190, Manufacturer Specs: Otis, KONE, ThyssenKrupp, Schindler, Mitsubishi
